title: Right of the accused to legal representation

content.question: Which of the following scenarios would be considered a violation of the rights of someone accused of a crime, according to the Supreme Court?

choices.label: A witness is called to testify against a suspect accused of plotting a terrorist attack.
A police officer acts to stop a crime while it is being committed but does so without a warrant.
A person who is unable to afford an attorney is tried and convicted of a crime without legal representation.
A suspect is informed of the right to an attorney but confesses to a crime prior to receiving legal advice.

content.answer: A person who is unable to afford an attorney is tried and convicted of a crime without legal representation.

topic.text: 3.8: Amendments: Due Process and the Rights of the Accused
